dogs.description: Small, muscular, smooth-coated dog with bat ears; affectionate and playful.
dogs.fun_fact: Frenchies were companions of lace workers in 19th‑century England before gaining fame in France.

dogs.description: Friendly, outgoing gun dog; highly trainable and great with families.
dogs.fun_fact: Originally bred in Newfoundland to help fishermen retrieve nets and fish.

dogs.description: Dense, water-repellent coat, friendly and intelligent retriever.
dogs.fun_fact: Bred in Scotland in mid-1800s for retrieving waterfowl.

dogs.description: Large, agile herding dog; intelligent, versatile, and used in police and military roles.
dogs.fun_fact: First bred in 1899 for herding; now a global leader in protection roles.

dogs.description: Highly intelligent, active dog with curly coat; comes in standard, miniature, and toy sizes.
dogs.fun_fact: Originally bred in Germany as a water retriever; name likely from German 'Pudel' meaning 'to splash'.

dogs.description: Medium-built, wrinkled face, short-muzzled with a calm, friendly demeanor.
dogs.fun_fact: Originally bred for bull-baiting, now a gentle companion.

dogs.description: Small to medium scent hound; curious, friendly, and great with children.
dogs.fun_fact: Often used in airports for sniffing contraband due to their exceptional sense of smell.

dogs.description: Large, powerful guardian dog; confident, loyal, and protective.
dogs.fun_fact: Descended from ancient Roman drover dogs; named after the town of Rottweil in Germany.

dogs.description: Versatile hunting dog; energetic, smart, and easy to train.
dogs.fun_fact: Developed in the 19th century in Germany for pointing and retrieving.

dogs.description: Short-legged, long-bodied hound; brave, clever, and curious.
dogs.fun_fact: Bred in Germany to scent, chase, and flush out badgers.

dogs.description: Small herding dog; spirited, affectionate, and devoted.
dogs.fun_fact: Queen Elizabeth II kept over 30 Pembroke Welsh Corgis during her reign.

dogs.description: Small, elegant dog with hairless and powderpuff varieties; affectionate and lively.
dogs.fun_fact: Remained rare until the 1990s when they became a hit with celebrity owners.

dogs.description: Toy terrier; confident, sprightly, and affectionate.
dogs.fun_fact: Originally bred to catch rats in clothing mills in Northern England.

dogs.description: Medium herding dog; intelligent, energetic, and good-natured.
dogs.fun_fact: Despite the name, the breed was developed in the U.S. for American shepherds.

dogs.description: Small, elegant toy spaniel; affectionate, gentle, and adaptable.
dogs.fun_fact: Named after King Charles II of England, who adored the breed.

dogs.description: Large Italian mastiff; powerful, protective, and loyal.
dogs.fun_fact: Once used by Romans in war, now favored as a guardian and police dog.

dogs.description: Medium-large guard dog; intelligent, alert, and energetic.
dogs.fun_fact: Named after Karl Friedrich Louis Dobermann, a German tax collector who developed the breed.

dogs.description: Medium-large; strong, fun-loving, and good with families.
dogs.fun_fact: Boxers have a powerful bite but typically avoid using it—until playtime!

dogs.description: Small, alert terrier; friendly, smart, and hardy.
dogs.fun_fact: Originally bred to hunt rats on German farms.

dogs.description: Large working dog; calm, affectionate, and strong.
dogs.fun_fact: One of four Swiss mountain dog breeds; valued for draft and farmwork.

dogs.description: Small toy dog; outgoing, affectionate, and alert.
dogs.fun_fact: Name means 'lion dog' in Chinese; bred for Chinese royalty.

dogs.description: Giant breed; friendly giant, easygoing, and affectionate.
dogs.fun_fact: Ancient breed from Germany; warned of medieval boar hunters.

dogs.description: Small Spitz-type dog; lively, bold, and friendly.
dogs.fun_fact: Queen Victoria owned a tiny Pomeranian, popularizing the small size.

dogs.description: Small, compact; friendly, intelligent, and tuxedo-like coat.
dogs.fun_fact: Nicknamed the 'American Gentleman' for its smart appearance and manners.

dogs.description: Small herding dog; smart, agile, and versatile.
dogs.fun_fact: Also known as Miniature Australian Shepherd; recognized as separate breed in 2015.

dogs.description: Small companion dog; friendly, intelligent, and adaptable.
dogs.fun_fact: The national dog of Cuba; nearly went extinct after Castro's rise.

dogs.description: Medium working dog; energetic, friendly, and good for cold climates.
dogs.fun_fact: Originated with the Chukchi people of Siberia, used for sled pulling.

dogs.description: Tiny toy dog; lively, devoted, and alert.
dogs.fun_fact: One of the oldest breeds, named after Mexican state of Chihuahua.

dogs.description: Medium gundog; friendly, athletic, and eager to please.
dogs.fun_fact: Traditionally used to 'spring' game during hunting.

dogs.description: Small herding dog; bright, agile, and reserved with strangers.
dogs.fun_fact: Originally from Scotland’s Shetland Islands; named 'Sheltie'.

dogs.description: Medium herding dog; extremely intelligent, energetic, and trainable.
dogs.fun_fact: Considered the most intelligent dog breed.

dogs.description: Medium gundog; versatile, affectionate, and agile.
dogs.fun_fact: From Brittany, France, and originally called the Brittany Spaniel.

dogs.description: Medium-large herding dog; intelligent, energetic, and protective.
dogs.fun_fact: Widely used in military and police roles worldwide.

dogs.description: Short-legged scent hound; gentle, laid-back, and stubborn.
dogs.fun_fact: Known for their long ears, which sweep scents toward their nose.

dogs.description: Medium gundog; energetic, affectionate, and obedient.
dogs.fun_fact: Hungarian breed known as 'Hungarian Pointer'.

dogs.description: Medium gundog; cheerful, affectionate, and compact.
dogs.fun_fact: Name comes from 'woodcock', the game bird they were bred to flush.

dogs.description: Tiny toy dog; gentle, playful, and lively.
dogs.fun_fact: Ancient breed from Malta; often mentioned in art and poetry.

dogs.description: Small, wrinkled, short-muzzled; charming, affectionate, and mischievous.
dogs.fun_fact: Beloved companions of Chinese emperors over 2,000 years ago.

dogs.description: Medium herding dog; graceful, loyal, and intelligent.
dogs.fun_fact: Made famous by Lassie—the fictional collie from books, movies, and TV.

dogs.description: Giant breed; gentle, dignified, and protective.
dogs.fun_fact: One of the heaviest dog breeds; some are called English Mastiffs.
